# Descriptive statistics
Now that you have designed a bullet proof experiment, and collected lots of good data, we need to move to data analysis. Here is where the fun begins. We will use for these process and I will assume you do not know anything about **R**. So lets get started.

```{r chunk01, echo = FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
p<- ggplot(faithful, aes(x = waiting))+ xlim(0,100) +
geom_dotplot(binwidth = 1.5,fill="purple",color="black")  +
theme_bw()   +
theme(panel.border = element_blank(),
                     panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
                     panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), 
                     axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black"),
                     axis.line.y = element_blank(),
                     axis.title.y=element_blank(),
                      axis.text.y=element_blank(),
                      axis.ticks.y=element_blank())

p
```
